law.catch_line: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, employment is covered employment if the employment is...

text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, employment is covered employment if the employment is:
performed for a charitable, educational, religious, or other organization; and
excluded from the definition of "employment" in the Federal Unemployment Tax Act solely by § 3306(c)(8) of the Act.

Employment is not covered employment if the employment is performed for:
a church or an association or convention of churches; or
an organization that is:
operated primarily for religious purposes; and
controlled, operated, principally supported, or supervised by a church or an association or convention of churches.

Employment is not covered employment if the employment is performed by:
a commissioned, licensed, or ordained minister of a church in the exercise of the ministry; or
a member of a religious order in the exercise of duties required by the order.

During any calendar quarter in which the compensation is less than $50, the employment is not covered employment if it is performed for an organization that is exempt from income tax under:
§ 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code unless the organization is described in § 401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code; or
§ 521 of the Internal Revenue Code.
